Description:
Inner-city sanctuary of space and serenity
A spectacular warehouse conversion of unexpected space and style, this stunning tri-level home offers a peaceful lifestyle sanctuary in a vibrant inner-urban location. With its own street frontage, secure and secluded beyond heritage façade, this cleverly-zoned home is extremely spacious and inviting at the same time with plenty of exposed brick walls and soaring vaulted ceilings underpinning contemporary designer touches. 3 large bedrooms (2/WIRs, 1/study nook, main/sleek ensuite) are served by superb family bathroom and laundry whilst upper level is dedicated to everyday living and entertaining with stone/Smeg kitchen (integrated fridge/freezer) and light-filled open-plan areas unfolding to sky-high north balcony. Industrial chic on the fringe of Clifton Hill Village near Yarra parklands, cafes and transport also featuring hydronic heating, air-conditioner, lower level double glazing, intercom entry and auto-under-cover parking for 2 cars with internal access.
Insights: 1/2 Groom Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 3 other 3 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
The Trojan Horse
Things are not always as they first appear: and so it goes with this traditional family home on a ultra-wide land allotment (270 sqm approx.) overlooking the beautiful streets of old Clifton Hill. A residence held dear to a single family for generations, it now returns to market offering its fortunate new owner incredible potential on luxuriously large land. What will you discover hidden behind its vanilla brickwork facade and decorative lacework?
Featuring the immediately recognisable 'northside' floorplan typical of this quaint pocket of Melbourne, the home enjoys lofty grand-height ceilings throughout and delightful art deco flourishes including delicate ceiling plasterwork, ornate fireplaces and fretwork. Take your pick from two living zones: a space best described as the 'good lounge' - a comforting room with space to welcome and reward your friends and family around a grand dining table, and a cosy family/dining room for casual meals, warming up by the heater and catching up on TV favorites. The spotless retro kitchen comes direct from Melbourne circa 1970s, with meander pattern floors, long aluminium double sink and solid Westinghouse gas cooker. Both bedrooms are extraordinarily large with peaceful neighbourhood vistas, and are accommodated by a simple bathroom with bath/shower combination in a vintage pink.
Begin your own family tradition by taking a seat under the broad, shady front porch in the calm hours before dusk, watching the neighbourhood return from a day's work. To the rear of the home, a leafy tree surveys the generous yard replete with ROW parking, exterior storage shed and laundry. Positioned ideally, you're but a stroll to the Ramsden Street Reserve and the bushland setting of the Merri Creek Trail which leads to the Fairfield Boathouse - and only minutes from Clifton Hill Station, the Darling Gardens and the shopping and cafe culture of Queens Parade and High Street Northcote.
More than meets the eye, indeed.
Anthony Gattuso : 0417 330 257
Insights: 157 Roseneath Street, CLIFTON HILL VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in CLIFTON HILL have recently been sold.

Description:
Luxury On Every Level And City Views!
Experience your dream inner city lifestyle with this brand new architecturally inspired residence spread over three luxurious levels. With three elegant bedrooms, two lavish bathrooms and designated study space, it offers executive families and professionals an enviable existence. Maximising natural light, an open plan design comprises kitchen, dining area and bright living domain with large glass aspects flowing onto an alfresco balcony boasting city views.
Showcasing function and form, the high-end kitchen features stone waterfall bench and Blanco appliances. Private accommodation is provided by a lower level master with an ensuite, whilst two upstairs bedrooms share a luxury bathroom. Further features include split-systems, intimate courtyard, automated garage and much more. Within minutes to Yarra parklands, Darling Gardens, cafes and transport.
Photo ID Required

Description:
HUGE PARCEL OF LAND
On an exceptionally deep block (200ft in the old scale), this grand Victorian presents an outstanding opportunity to renovate and extend (STCA) in one of inner-Melbourne's most exclusive neighbourhoods. Beyond its imposing Hawthorn-brick facade, the home's current floorplan boasts a wide central hallway accessing five spacious bedrooms, formal lounge and dining rooms - all with towering ceilings and ornate plaster details, plus functional bathroom, kitchen/meals area, study/storeroom and rear sunroom. Step outside to discover the home's most unique asset - a simply enormous backyard complete with numerous rustic outbuildings (workshop / storeroom / laundry / garage) and access to rear ROW. The makings of something truly spectacular, it offers instant access to Merri Creek parks and trails, Spensley Street Primary School, close to cafes and shops, Clifton Hill Station and Queens Parade trams. Land approx 667sqm. What an opportunity!
Insights: 99 Heidelberg Road, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 1 other 5 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Brilliant Floorplan
Its getting harder to find great square shaped living spaces, even harder with street frontage & so close to the city, here is one example.
Dressed to impress and priced to sell this townhouse comprises of 2 bedrooms two bathrooms ( ensuite to master ) , open plan lounge, dining and kitchen area with island bench top as well as a large study , laundry, big purpose built storage room and one off street car park accessed via remote control.
Featuring air conditioning to each bedroom, impressive polished concrete entrance, polished floorboards in the living area ( not floating floorboards ) stone top benches to wet areas and a large balcony.
Currently rented on a monthly tenancy at $550pw the tenants would stay on for a further 12 mths minimum if the lucky new owner chooses so.
Insights: 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Luxury Two-Level Living Footsteps to Darling Gardens
A Darling Gardens masterpiece of impressive dimensions where extra width is matched by impeccably detailed designer space; this luxurious two-level terrace is a compelling four bedroom, three bathroom and study domain of remarkable lifestyle appeal. Featuring city-side balcony with parkland backdrop plus north-facing rear landscaped oasis, indulge in one of Clifton Hill's most carefully-conceived contemporary transformations highlighting the homes impeccably restored heritage features, superior quality appointments, extensive and cleverly conceived storage architecturally designed to maximize space and stunning aesthetic form and functionality. Metres to the park, Queens Parade and schools, this sophisticated light-filled home includes fitted study, master bedroom with walk-in-robe, ensuite and retreat balcony, stylish living room (HeatnGlo gas fireplace), dining area opening to artistic waterwall deck, streamlined Smeg-equipped stone kitchen (72-bottle wine storage), European laundry, zoned heating/cooling, alarm, wide hardwood floors, electric blinds/windows, Italian feature lighting, BBQ and dining deck, north facing private courtyard and secure OSP.

Description:
UNCOMPROMISING QUALITY, SUPERBLY ZONED
This meticulously renovated 1880s residence on 293sqm (approx), combines period grace with sympathetic contemporary style includes a stunning multi-purpose studio, ideal as a home office, retreat or large third bedroom. Washed with light, this exceptional home, close to schools, Village cafes and parkland, offers a highly versatile floor plan incorporating two large double bedrooms (one with ensuite, second with WIR), an elegant dining room opening to side courtyard, expansive high-ceilinged living room with Lopi gas fire open to a magnificent kitchen with touch-close cabinetry, double Siemens ovens, Highland cooktop and Liebherr fridges, plus luxury bathroom/laundry. Including a tranquil landscaped courtyard to two sides, this fine home includes a double garage with adjoining bathroom, and features loft storage, reverse-cycle air conditioning, bespoke cabinetry throughout, polished blackbutt floors, cabling, solar-boosted HWS, double glazing and premium appointments.
Insights: 93 O'Grady Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
FAMILY SPACES . PARK PRECINCT
This late-Edwardian residence is a Clifton Hill classic, set on a large block with deep north-facing rear garden, close to Merri Creek parkland, Spensley St Primary and Queens Parade. Generously extended in high-ceilinged period style, this light-filled home comprises a spacious bay-windowed living room with OFP, open to a dining area flowing to brick paved-patio and garden, kitchen with solid timber benchtops, upper-level main bedroom/retreat with balcony and ensuite, 4 further double bedrooms, family bathroom with period-style fittings and full laundry. Including a ROW-access garage, this welcoming home features Baltic floors, understair storage, fine cornice detail, hydronic heating and air conditioning.

Description:
Views, Location & Lifestyle!
With expansive views and an abundance of natural light this spacious 2 bedroom top floor apartment is only a short stroll to the diverse eateries of the Clifton Hill Village & Queens Parade, a myriad of public transport options and acres of beautiful Yarra River parkland. The apartment itself was refurbished only a few years ago and comprises 2 double bedrooms with built in robes, generous living room with delightful northern orientation, industrial edge kitchen with picture perfect CBD view, bright bathroom with shower over bath & laundry facilities, separate toilet and undercover car space on title. Part of a well maintained complex with security intercom entry the apartment is currently leased to excellent tenants (returning $370.00 per week) and would make an ideal ongoing investment or extremely comfortable & convenient first purchase for an owner occupier.
Insights: 6/41 Fenwick Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
AFFORDABLE CITY-EDGE STYLE
This stylish contemporary apartment is the ideal entry to Clifton Hill, combining excellent investment potential with a convenient location close to transport, the Darling Gardens and Village cafes. Larger than many similar apartments (44 sq.m approx. plus 7 sq.m balcony), it offers a good-sized living and dining room open to a kitchen with Blanco appliances and glass splashbacks and flowing to a full-width balcony, one double bedroom (BIRs), a fully-tiled bathroom (overbath shower) and concealed laundry, plus secure carspace, intercom entry and split-system air conditioning.

Description:
Groomed for success - Delightful inner city living
Timeless Victorian appeal combined with the best in contemporary style, this freestanding home delivers an alluring lifestyle of quality, privacy and enviable city-edge convenience. Ready-made for modern living, the home's impressively spacious interior boasts a wide side hallway accessing 2 generous bedrooms (master with full-width robes) and fully-renovated central bathroom, light-filled lounge/dining area and modern stone-top kitchen with dishwasher, soft-close drawers and 2-pac cabinet finishes. Add to this ducted heating and split-system air conditioning, polished timber floors, European laundry, plus a delightful back garden complete with paved entertaining area and secure off-street parking option via ROW. Immediate access to Yarra trails and Dights Falls, acres of parkland, it's also close to public transport and popular inner-urban cafe/shopping precincts.
Agent - hockingtuart
Michael Amarant : 0411 144 569

Description:
DISTINGUISHED CONVERSION WITH COURTYARD OASIS
This former shoe factory, converted by award-winning architect Suzanne Dance with later design by Techne Architects, offers a highly versatile floor plan featuring two living zones separated by a wonderful sanctuary garden oasis with decking - perfect for al fresco entertaining. With distinctive curved walls, soaring roof trusses and exposed ceiling beams along with streams of light, this expansive family home includes a spacious sitting room, north-facing informal living and dining open to a well-equipped kitchen, main bedroom/retreat plus three further bedrooms, loft study, three bathrooms, large laundry and a ROW-access garage/workshop with cellar and further storage. This is an impressive and truly unique property situated close to Village cafes, schools, parklands and Queens Parade. Other features include new bamboo flooring, ducted central heating, split-system air conditioning and quality fittings. A must see! Land size 280sqm (approx). Nelson Alexander Pty Ltd.
Insights: 63 Dally Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 10 other 4 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
47M OF DEPTH* - IT'S ALL ABOUT THE LAND
Set well back from the street, this free-standing Victorian residence, meticulously renovated on a large block (329sqm approx.), is distinguished by generously proportioned principal rooms and a fine address close to Queens Parade, Brunswick Street and the Edinburgh Gardens. A classic floorplan comprises three light-filled double bedrooms and a stunning new bathroom (bath, shower and stone benchtops) from a wide arched hallway, an elegant living and dining room with gas log OFP, and an expansive kitchen/informal meals area with French Provincial cabinetry and premium appliances. Including a deep courtyard and ample ROW-access parking, this distinctive home features period detail, air conditioning, custom storage and alarm system.

Description:
RENOVATED TO PERFECTION, PRIME POSITION
This block-fronted Victorian residence displays high-end architectural style. With light-filled rooms and a floating feature staircase, it offers a beautifully zoned floor plan incorporating an upper-level bedroom/retreat with WIR and striking ensuite (free-standing bath and shower), two further double bedrooms (custom BIRs), an expansive living and dining room with high ceilings and gas log fire, opening to a deck and private courtyard with ROW-access parking, designer kitchen with bespoke cabinetry and premium appliances, an elegant main bathroom plus concealed laundry. Close to Village cafes, schools, transport and Yarra parkland, this stunning home includes polished timber floors, plantation shutters and split-system air conditioning.

Description:
Auction This Saturday at 11.00am View From 10.40am
A Commanding Victorian Terrace with Appeal and Potential
Situated in an elevated position in this coveted wide street adjacent expansive parklands this very comfortable terrace has a typical floor plan immediately livable but presenting with so much more potential. The side hall gives access to two generous bedrooms, then whilst unusual the floor plan works well with entry to a well equipped modern kitchen before opening to two adjoining rooms that serve as a dining and lounge room.
The bathroom and laundry are positioned to the rear and the house exudes warmth and character and can be let or occupied as is, or for those with a keen eye to further capital value there’s a generous rear northerly yard with car access. The allotment is sizeable and the potential to undertake extensions, perhaps adding a second level make this a very desirable property.

Description:
Inner City Sophistication with City Views
Crisp, modern and incorporating stylish timber touches, this sophisticated brand new three bedroom, two bathroom residence sets the standard for low maintenance living.
With open plan living and meals showcasing a stunning timber screen, complemented by a superb kitchen boasting stone benchtops and stainless steel appliances together with a welcoming balcony, entertaining is effortless.
Bedrooms include BIR's, one with magnificent city views, and are serviced by luxuriously fitted bathrooms with statement tapware. With gorgeous timber floors, study nook, single lock up garage with remote door, additional car space, reverse cycle heating and cooling, video security and alarm, brilliantly positioned to the Yarra parklands, bike trails, transport, and a mere 5 kilometres from the CBD, your sophisticated life starts here.

Description:
WHEN SPACE AND POSITION MATTER
This immaculate tuckpointed Edwardian residence blends period charm, modern comfort and a prime address close to Clifton Hill station and Village, Yarra parkland and primary schools. With a northerly aspect, light-filled rear extension and landscaped garden, this appealing home offers a versatile floor plan comprising two double bedrooms plus a sunny mezzanine study, a very spacious sitting room with clerestory windows and open fireplace, expansive dining/informal living adjoining well-equipped kitchen, and a large central bathroom/laundry. Including a deep paved courtyard with ROW access parking, this impressive home features polished timber floors, decorative ceilings, ample storage, gas heating and split-system air conditioning.
Insights: 71 Ramsden Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
"YES, THE PRICE IS NOT A MISPRINT"
The price is correct. Offering exceptional value for money, this very large contemporary home promises a relaxed lifestyle moments from Dight's Falls and Yarra parkland and close to Clifton Hill Village and transport. Appealing as a city-edge home or secure investment, it offers a versatile floorplan comprising spacious living and dining areas separated by a stylish Miele-equipped kitchen, three bedrooms with double glazing, two ensuites, third bathroom and concealed laundry. Including a private lock up garage, entrance courtyard and balconies opening from the living area, this light-filled property features split-system air conditioning, alarm system and generous storage. Anticipated rental return of $700 - $750 per week*.
Insights: 6 Barries Place, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2015 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
Inspirational Living, Idyllic Setting, Inviting Location
From the outset with its clean timber look in a central village position it's clear that this captivating residence with secluded north-facing rear alfresco area is one out of the box. Cleverly conceived with a stylish simplicity and indoor-outdoor synergy, this wide contemporary home's single-storey layout lets you focus on easy living and entertaining in its superbly proportioned spaces. Walking is the way to go here so time-savingly close to cafes, shops, schools, parkland, gym/pool, pub and train station - what an all-round lifestyle opportunity! This private and peaceful retreat features two large bedrooms (built-in-robes), sun-drenched living/dining room adjoining brilliantly appointed kitchen both with bifold doors to entertainment deck and lush garden, huge central bathroom with spa bath, laundry, ducted heating, alarm and polished floorboards.
Andrew Simondson : 0412 999 128
Insights: 54 Spensley Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2018 and 16 other 2 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
PRIME OPPORTUNITY - RENOVATE OR REDEVELOP
This spacious 1960s residence is a chance not to be missed! In a quiet cul de sac, it offers scope to renovate, redevelop and extend (STCA), or to create a fine contemporary home close to Clifton Hill Village and transport, schools and the Darling Gardens. With deep windows, lots of natural light and ducted heating and cooling, it comprises three double bedrooms, a good-sized living room, original kitchen, bathroom, laundry and separate WC, on a northerly garden block with shed storage, off-street parking and ROW at rear. Land size: 280m2 approximately.
In Conjunction with Steveway Real Estate - Steven Pantelios 0417 311 006
Insights: 8 Peckville Street, Clifton Hill VIC 3068 was last sold in 2017 and 25 other 3 bedroom house in Clifton Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
A LIFESTYLE OF SOPHISTICATION
Position perfect, with an inner city retreat feel, you will fall in love with this immaculate sun drenched town residence.
- 3 large bedrooms - 2nd bedroom with BIR, master with WIR and ensuite
- Brilliant north facing open plan living and dining area - polished boards, reverse cycle heating/cooling
- Sliding doors opening to a huge entertainers terrace
- Stunning well appointed kitchen- gas Miele cooktop, dishwasher, breakfast bar, walk in pantry
- 2 sleek bathrooms - main with bath; Concealed laundry; Separate powder room
- High ceilings; loads of natural light; additional functional study nook area; loads of storage space
- Lock up garage with internal access plus a carport
Highly sought after location close to Darling Gardens, Queens Parade cafes and restaurants, brilliant schools, the Merri Creek, bike paths, public transport & loads more!
Conditions of entry - IDENTIFICATION and contact number required, otherwise entry may be refused.
Property Code: 6174
